block.p: Dr. Amita Mahajan and Dr. Deepak Vadada were married yesterday at the Sheraton Parsippany Hotel in New Jersey. Pandit Venugopal G. Devdhar, a Hindu priest, officiated.
The bride and bridegroom received their medical degrees from Drexel.
Dr. Amita Mahajan and Dr. Deepak Vadada were married Saturday at the Sheraton Parsippany Hotel in New Jersey. Pandit Venugopal G. Devdhar, a Hindu priest, officiated.
Dr. Amita Mahajan and Dr. Deepak Vadada were married yesterday at the Sheraton Parsippany Hotel in New Jersey. Pandit Venugopal G. Devdhar, a Hindu priest, officiated.
The bride and bridegroom received their medical degrees from Drexel.

The bride, 26, is an ophthalmology resident at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center in New York. She graduated from Villanova. She is a daughter of Usha and Om Mahajan of Ocean, N.J. Her father is an electrical engineer for Avaya, an information technology company in Middletown, N.J. Her mother retired as a computer programmer for AIG Insurance in Neptune, N.J.

The bridegroom, 27, is an internal medicine resident at Lenox Hill Hospital in New York, where he will become a fellow in gastroenterology in July next year. He graduated from Monmouth University. He is a son of Dr. Veera Padmini Vadada and Dr. Suresh Vadada of Mansfield, Ohio. His mother is a family physician at Richmond County Medical Associates, a medical clinic in Mansfield, and his father is a nephrologist at Kidney Associates, a group practice, also in Mansfield.
